message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IR 

This paper is about neural machine translation (NMT), which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the computer science category of "Computation and Language" (cs.CL). The paper proposes a method for zero-resource NMT, which means training an NMT model without parallel corpora available. This is a challenging problem in NMT and requires techniques from machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The proposed method involves using a pivot language to train the NMT model, which is a technique commonly used in computer vision (cs.CV) for domain adaptation. Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed method using BLEU score, which is a common metric in information retrieval (cs.IR).
